conclusion: Initial tension in the wires is due to the weight of the rod, mg.
When energized, the tension in each wire becomes 1/4 mg.
Initial tension equation: 2T₀ = mg, thus T₀ = 1/2 mg.
Energized tension equation: 2(1/4 mg) + F_B = mg.
Net force balance: F_B = mg - 2(1/4 mg) = 1/2 mg.
Solve for current I: I = (1/2 mg) / (BL), I = mg / (2BL).
Determine direction using the right-hand rule: current flows from N to M.
Final answer: Magnitude I = mg / (2BL), Direction from N to M.
